attributes.action: Scrap Tax on Savings Income altogether, NOT just the 1st £1000
attributes.background: As Interest rates on 'Savings Accounts' are at record lows currently, people are now struggling to live off their savings incomes, which the government taxes after the 1st £1000 income at 20%.
attributes.additional_details: The government can easily scrap this tax for savers, forever, in the next Budget, also, would save a lot of people having to complete the Self-Assessment to repay Savings Income above £1000.

attributes.action: Increase funding on nursing homes to lower the cost of carehomes for families.
attributes.background: We visited a nursing home and were disheartened by the patients' solitude. Our hearts were torn by watching the elderly in care being so fragile and frail, armed with the knowledge that they receive such little funding. So we have started a campaign in conjunction with this

attributes.action: Issue a two-year flight ban for travelers who cause disruption on airplanes
attributes.background: Airplane security is essential not only when combatting terrorism but for travelers to feel generally safe and ensure there are no added risks to flying. Recently, poor or drunken behaviour by some travelers has caused distress and has even required planes to be diverted.
attributes.additional_details: Increasingly there are stories of drunken and rowdy passengers causing problems on flights in and around Europe. Unfortunately, many of these are British travelers. At a time when airline safety is critical, this unwanted behaviour is creating added pressure and fining the travelers is often not a strong enough sanction. A two-year flight ban would hopefully be a more suitable sanction and also act as a deterrent.

attributes.action: Change the law so child sex offenders do not have contact with their children
attributes.background: Most children are protected by the law in areas that prevents child sex offenders having access to places where children are present . However children of sex offenders are not privy to the protection and given access to manipulators and grooming behaviour under supervision of unqualified people.
attributes.additional_details: If a child isn't a social services child , and the other parent poses no threat then social services will not supervise,or provide centres. As a result it forces the supervisor which may be a family member or ex partner, to have them into their homes or be witnessed by others associating with a known sex offender. This may put the child's safety at risk .If the supervisor isn't educated about grooming they may inadvertadly put the child at risk.Why are our children not worth adequate protection?

attributes.action: Simplify the motorcycle test
attributes.background: Since the implementation of directive 2006/126/EEC the UK motorcycle test has become unnecessarily complicated and prohibitively expensive.
attributes.additional_details: The closed circuit part of the test that ensures riding at 50 KMH is totally irrelevant. We wish to see a structured sensible test similar to the previous test that provided safe training and restricted access to powerful bikes for a short period as we believe this was the most successful version of motorcycle testing. We believe that structured training is preferable to complicated legislation as a way to reduce accidents.

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid - divert to, Health, Police, Military, and Pensioners
attributes.background: Foreign aid 11 billion budget to increase by £1 billion (That is money the UK Government borrows to give away).The UK  spends more than any other country and is the second largest aid donor in the world (The Telegraph)  Despite in 2015 UK government debt amounted to £1.56 trillion(economicshelp.org)
attributes.additional_details:
In January, it emerged that civil servants had gone on a £1billion spending spree over eight weeks last year to hit the government target of allocating 0.7 per cent of national income to overseas aid.
BRITAIN's spending on foreign aid will be LARGER than the entire Home Office budget in each of the next five years - reaching a staggering £16BILLION, it was revealed. Pakistan who is a Nuclear Power and not so long ago bought a fleet of fighters off the USA get the highest amount 351 million.

attributes.action: Stop taxing hard working people on their overtime. Tax on basic 40hrs only
attributes.background: Over time should be tax free as people don't want to do it but for most it's a must to help them live.

attributes.action: Stop Prison 'Reform' from going ahead. More rights for victims please!
attributes.background: The Queen detailed prison reform in her speech today, which includes giving prisoners the right to live at home on weekdays and free iPads with Skype to contact family while serving time. This is not punishment and makes a joke of the victim's rights.

attributes.action: Move parliament away from the Palace of Westminster to Carlisle, Cumbria
attributes.background: London-centric government leads to a distorted view of the UK and a disproportionate distribution of resource. The Northern Power House discussion mistakenly sees the Merseyside/Manchester/Leeds axis as the North of England. Government from Carlisle will shift more than just the base of politics.
attributes.additional_details: The problems of poor infrastructure, transport and communication can be ignored while the British Government continues to rule from Westminster. The North East has at least reasonable transport links; Cumbria boasts two lane trunk roads. Much of Cumbria has poor mobile signal and even poorer broadband.  What might change if the Government had to try to function in that environment.  This time Cumbria, after 10 years perhaps another northern county, then perhaps Cornwall!

attributes.action: Enforce dog licences for everyone pet owners and breeders. Toughen up on laws!
attributes.background: Everyone should be registered on a database & buy a dog licence that wants to own one! Anyone breeding be it once or several times should have to be checked by an authority to show they are equipped and have the education to do it properly, the laws need to be toughened up on those who abuse them!
attributes.additional_details: The increase in puppy prices is soring, in turn there are more irresponsible breeders and owners breeding just to make quick cash! they're not been bred for health or temprement, this is causing rescues to overflow as these puppies are growing into unhealthy untrainable and some cases dangerous dogs. This petition is to enforce licences on all dog owners and breeders and make them liable for any consequences of their dogs! Those caught not been licenced need prosecuting or jail!

attributes.action: Make all foreign vehicles entering the UK pay a road tax.
attributes.background: When we drive across the channel we are expected to pay road tax in many European countries, either by way of motorway tolls, or by purchasing a vignette.  However, any vehicle can enter the UK from Europe and are able to travel free of road tax.  Why is this allowed to carry on?
attributes.additional_details: Vignettes could be purchased at the port of entry, or on line, in much the same way as the purchase system on the borders of Switzerland and Austria.  In Switzerland we have to purchase an annual vignette, and in Austria we are able to purchase a three month vignette.  Our roads are crammed with foreign trucks, and I strongly believe that some form of British road tax should be levied to ease the burden of the high road repair costs.

attributes.action: Make it tougher for foreign buyers to purchase UK properties
attributes.background: Places like Denmark, Singapore, Hong Kong, Switzerland & Australia have made it much tougher or more expensive for foreign buyers to snap up homes. However, UK still allows foreigners to buy and sell properties as they wish, making profits but pushing up prices which many UK families cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask that the needs of the British people be met first. A lot of foreign investment properties are empty when British workers are finding it harder and harder to even rent a place. 

Currently UK property developers like to pre-sell their developments to overseas buyers because, unlike UK buyers, they pay a deposit of 20% even before the project has started. It helps to finance their projects but makes Brits second priority.

attributes.action: ban betting advertising and sponsorship on television and UK press.
attributes.background:
the level of betting advertising is growing out of control.
Its everywhere;
TV adverts
Programme sponsorship
TV channel sponsorship
Sports event sponsors

Most offer free bets, or free money bets as incentives.

Gambling is addictive and destroys family life.
attributes.additional_details:
The way in which betting companies advertise need strict control, to curb the ever increasing problem of gambling addiction.
The massive increase in the number of online betting sites being able to fund such promotional activity is testimony to their success at the expense of UK households.

This is not the kind of enterprise we should be promoting.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display it's nutritional information
attributes.background: It is the law to display nutritional information on all food and drink except for alcoholic drinks. Many people use this information for any dietary issues they may have, from a simple diet to type 1 diabetes. Without nutritional information it is impossible to consume alcohol for some people.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol is extremely calorific and I believe people would change their views on how much they drink if they knew what was in what they drink. Also being diabetic myself, I have to use insulin depending on how much carbohydrate I consume, which is impossible to know with alcohol, and could pose and extremely dangerous health risk.

attributes.action: Enforce senior drivers to re-take their driving test
attributes.background: Lots of senior drivers didn't have to sit a formal driving test and even more didn't have to sit one that was adequate. It should be a legal requirement for drivers at the age of 70 to re-sit a upto date driving test that they desperately need. This would improve the safety of roads in general

attributes.action: Give Every Woman The Right To Become A Mother Through IVF On The NHS.
attributes.background: In 2012, we lost our baby at 20 weeks pregnant. After being under a consultant on the NHS for 2 years in November 2015 we were told because my husband has 2 children they can't do anymore for us. All I want is to be a mother due to having endometriosis falling pregnant naturally is difficult.
attributes.additional_details:
IVF on the NHS 
NHS trusts across England and Wales are working to provide the same levels of service. However, the provision of IVF treatment varies across the country and often depends on local CCG policies. 

CCGs may have additional criteria you need to meet before you can have IVF on the NHS, such as:
•not having any children already, from both your current and any previous relationships 
•being a healthy weight 
•not smoking 
•falling into a certain age range

attributes.action: To Issue National Identity Cards for everyone to protect our National Security.
attributes.background: With the ongoing threat to our borders and security, it is time to introduce a National Identity Card. This must be issued to all UK citizens and to all successful immigration applicants and should be carried at all times. This is a necessary step forward assist our Police and Immigration services.
attributes.additional_details: The refusal of the Government and the opposition of those who defend their privacy, are undermining the security and safety of the majority of people who wish to protect the UK and have nothing to hide!

attributes.action: Allow Doctors to Issue Temporary Disabled Parking Badges
attributes.background: Many people leave hospital and are vulnerable and have extremely limited mobility. I believe GPs and Doctors should be able to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help people with temporary issues
attributes.additional_details:
Many people leave hospital have had invasive or life changing surgery and are signed off work for weeks or even moths to recover. During this time no provision is made to help them access shops, pharmacists or even hospitals!

I would like to empower Doctors to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help post operative patients rehabilitate.

These badges would give the bearer the same access rights as the current Disabled Badge scheme however they would expire as patients recover.

attributes.action: Recognition of the Armenian Genocide
attributes.background: I would like HM Government to recognise the events that overtook the Armenian population [of what is now E Turkey] around 1915 as 'genocide'. HM Government to follow the lead of EU partners - such as France & Austria - who already recognise those events as 'genocide'.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of a parliamentary discussion, MPs should consider whether the terrible Jewish holocaust/genocide differs from that which overtook the Armenia population [of E Turkey] around 1915. Nearly two million innocent people were killed during those events.

Furthermore, why, since the Jewish genocide has been officially recognised by HM Government, is it the case that the Armenian genocide remains unacknowledged - given the criteria set down in the 1942 UN declaration on Genocide?

attributes.action: Ban the sale of honey in order to fight the decline in bee populations
attributes.background: The impact that the honey industry has on bee populations is detrimental - by taking away their honey, we are depriving them of their ability to feed their young and to insulate their hives. We demand a total ban on the sale of honey in the UK to help protect our bees from extinction.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently, there has been lots of media coverage surrounding the decline in bee populations. It is no secret that if bees go extinct, we are only a couple of years behind.
Bees produce honey for two reasons – to feed their young, and to insulate their hives, therefore by taking their honey from them we are depriving them of their ability to carry out these essential survival functions. It is vital that we stop this practice for the bees' sake, for our sake and for the sake of our planet.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK
attributes.background:
The UK fails to recycle over 1.5 million tonnes of plastic packaging waste each year, which ends up in landfill & waterways instead. 

Creating packaging that our society cannot deal with is blatantly unsustainable. We urgently need 100% recyclable/compostable packaging on every product in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK currently recycles 64% of all packaging waste, but only about 32% of plastic packaging waste.

This is unacceptable. We cannot let big business create more packaging that our society cannot deal with - it may be good for profits but it is irresponsible and unsustainable.

We call upon our leaders to take action: to ban all non-sustainable packaging on all products, with a grace period of 5 years to allow manufacturers to integrate viable, sustainable alternatives into their supply chains.

attributes.action: Make the result of debates triggered by these Petitions binding on Government.
attributes.background: Government's response to the 2nd Referendum Petition, which has gained over 4 million signatures, let slip that any debate triggered by it would have no legal force. We may be wasting our time participating in these petitions unless that changes.
attributes.additional_details:
I quote as evidence this, taken from the initial response to the 2nd Referendum petition:
'The Committee wishes to make clear that, although it may choose to schedule a debate on this petition in due course, it only has the power to schedule debates in Westminster Hall – the second debating chamber of the House of Commons. Debates in Westminster Hall do not have the power to change the law, and could not trigger a second referendum.'

attributes.action: Make ABP and other former public sector bodies protect historic buildings.
attributes.background: Grimsby was once the largest fishing port in the world.  Associated British Ports (ABP) is demolishing the 19th century buildings at the heart of the historic port of Grimsby.  ABP have permitted development rights - no planning application is needed.
attributes.additional_details: ABP was formerly the British Transport Docks Board.  Other industries formerly in the public sector have legal duties to consider historic buildings (e.g. in Water Industry Act 1991, section 3 and Electricity Act 1989, Schedule 9).  The law should be changed so that ABP (and other bodies formerly in the public sector) are subject to similar duties.

attributes.action: Ban all Non Biodegradable packaging from being used
attributes.background:
Not only does the burning of fossil fuels pollute the air we breath, and slowly raise the sea levels adding more and more fresh water slowly desalinated them.
Likewise the use of plastics in packaging is another huge risk to the oceans as it poisons or strangles the marine life.
attributes.additional_details:
widely 'over' used to replace glass or other natural biodegradables.
Thousands of tonnes get into our oceans every year, which poisons any marine life around them.
While in the sea it simply gets broken into smaller chunks, now easily consumable by all marine life
We then eat these animals unwittingly POISONING ourselves.
Everyone hates trying to tear or cut through these types of packing anyway, so let's get rid of them!
We need to be more careful with our planet or we will lose it!

attributes.action: Abolish the puppy trade
attributes.background: Recently seen visual images regarding how dogs are held captive and bread in small cages in order to be sold on the high street. Dogs should not be sold or treated this way. I want action because animal cruelty should not be acceptable in any circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: A recent documentary by the BBC called 'Britain's Puppy Dealers: exposed' illustrated real examples of dog dealers and how dogs and puppies are left in small cages without heat, food or any air holes, and how small puppies were dumped on the side of the road because they were either dead or not up to standard. This type of evidence illustrates why this needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Change UK licensing laws to allow drug testing in nightclubs.
attributes.background: Despite current laws, 1 in 5 young adults used illicit drugs last year, of unknown purity and strength and have been attributed to the deaths of 50 people in 2014, a trend which is increasing. By allowing safe drug tests in venues, users will be aware of the composition and lives could be saved.
attributes.additional_details: Drug testing has been used in Europe and at UK festivals with Police and PHA support. There needs to be a debate on how this can be implemented across the night time industry so that it's customers can be as informed as they are with alcohol choices. The tragedy of these deaths is conversely having an impact on that economy. There were a further 14000 hospital admissions which is additional burden on the NHS. Statistics: http://digital.nhs.uk/catalogue/PUB21159/drug-misu-eng-2016-rep.pdf

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use by over 16s
attributes.background: Cannabis has been a Class B drug in the UK since 2009, meaning that it's illegal to sell, distribute, or use the drug in any way. However, millions of people throughout the UK still take advantage of cannabis for their recreational use, often turning to backstreet dealers who are making thousands.
attributes.additional_details:
If cannabis was commercially available in UK pharmacies & supermarkets, not only would British businesses profit massively, but the VAT attached would make millions of pounds for the UK economy, which could be spent on things such as a better-funded NHS & more modern facilities for our schools. 

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: A Gen Election before Article 50, free of first past the post for EU membership.
attributes.background:
We dispute the EU referendum result; due to numbers against and that the Leave Campaign substantially misled the Electorate.  

Both Conservatives and Labour have promised to enforce the vote.  This promise blocks at least 48% of the Electorate from revisiting this issue in elections due (cont)
attributes.additional_details:
(cont) to the first past the post rule violating almost half of the UK’s democratic rights.

We demand a general election free of the first past the post rule to determine EU membership prior to invoking Article 50, so as to give the maximum number of the British people a voice in their country's future.

http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/26/eu-referendum-brexit-vote-leave-iain-duncan-smith-nhs

Cameron and Corbyn are on record as respecting the referendum result to exit the EU.

attributes.action: Instate the death penalty for all paedophiles.
attributes.background: The European Convention of Human Rights has interfered with the rights of British children to be protected from the most depraved individuals infesting our society. The death penalty should be instated against all pedophiles, as the ultimate deterrent and the ultimate protection for our children.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophilia, parallels genocide as one of the most vile acts committed against the most vulnerable. It is our duty to protect children from all levels of harm. The present legal system of a few years to life in prison for pedophiles, fails completely to protect children. The soft penalty of prison, does nothing to deter offenders and entices paedophiles released from prison to offend again, and again and again. Hanging paedophiles will make them think twice before harming children.

attributes.action: Ban pre packed cooked bones being sold as dog treats
attributes.background:
Many dog owners are unaware of the dangers of giving their dog cooked bones. 
Lots of shops in the uk (not just pet shops) sell pre packed cooked bones as dog treats which are sold to dog owners everyday! Cooked bones can be deadly to dogs and many die every year because of this

attributes.action: Block Scotland spending another £14M of British money on another referendum.
attributes.background: The last referendum cost the British taxpayer £14M. If we come out of the EU, they are citing doing this again. They've already said no once, we cant waste another £14M on this again.

attributes.action: Make the North East Combined Authority give the people a vote on Devolution
attributes.background:
SUNDERLAND COUNCIL LEADER PAUL WATSON HAS TOLD THE NEWCASTLE CHRONICLE WE THE PUBLIC DON’T WANT A VOTE ON DEVOLUTION 
HE SEEMS TO HAVE FORGOTTEN WE HAVE ALREADY VOTED ON DEVOLUTION IN 2004 AND IT WAS A MASSIVE MAJORITY TO REJECT DEVOLUTION

attributes.action: Direct Councils to use the Mobile Home powers devolved to them, without option.
attributes.background: A 'criminal element' have been acquiring Sites. They use brutal intimidation to frighten elderly residents and they ignore any regulations. Although Councils have enormous powers under Planning and Licencing  they are reluctant to get involved, even when there is overwhelming evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The main legislation is the 1960 Caravan Act, the 1983  Mobile Home Act and the 2013 Mobile Home Act. Councils have been lethargic and even negligent in their policing of these Acts. 

There is a Parliamentary Working Group monitoring the 2013 Act, but they are not going to report until July 2017. The legislation must be made to work now and the rouges must either change their ways, or be relieved of the ownership of their Sites. Too many elderly residents are suffering hardship and abuse.

attributes.action: Amend the  Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: Due to the high number of dog attacks the aim is to force all dog owners to have their dog DNA taken and  register it with the dog's microchip. This  would allow all dogs to be screened for banned breed DNA and if attacks take place wounds could be swabbed and aggressors traced.
attributes.additional_details:
If a dog is  already microchipped the addresses are known and the owners could be contacted and asked to get the DNA profile done.
The DNA would also help with tracing of owners of dogs who leave poo uncollected, which will help District Councils prosecute culprits.

attributes.action: Make gender/sexuality a compulsory topic in PSHEE/P&E lessons in UK high schools
attributes.background: Many genders and sexualities are unheard of by most people, meaning it is difficult for those questioning to find a label which describes them. I think introducing a gender and sexuality topic in PSHEE/P&E classes in all high schools would assist those questioning and lessen homophobia in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Although the statistic for LGBT+ students is estimated, around 1 in 5 students are believed to be a part of the community. This means that approximately 646,900 students are LGBT+ and would benefit from this topic, as well as the remainder of students who will be more educated and aware of the many genders and sexualities there are.

attributes.action: Make spitting of Paan in public places a Civil offence.
attributes.background: Paan is a preparation combining betel leaf with areca nut and sometimes also with tobacco.It is chewed for its stimulant and psychoactive effects.
attributes.additional_details: Paan made with areca nut and lime, with or without tobacco, causes profuse red coloured salivation.This saliva is spat, yielding stains and biological waste pollution in public spaces. Many countries and municipalities have laws to prevent paan spit.Health effects of chewing paan: gum damage, tooth decay and oral cancer.

attributes.action: Hold a public enquiry into the legitimacy of the result of the EU Referendum.
attributes.background: The EU Referendum vote to leave the EU will make an irreversible change to the UK’s relationship to the rest of world. Remain and Leave campaigns, and unofficial campaigns, mislead the public on key factual information about our current and future relationship with the EU and the rest of the world.
attributes.additional_details:
We have a principal in the UK that we are not allowed to gain advantage by knowingly lying. Yet that is what has happened with the EU referendum. Both campaigns made statements that were not true.

The Leave campaign has achieved a narrow victory and we are now told that their main campaign promise “We send the EU £350 million a week let’s fund the NHS instead” is not possible.

We need an enquiry into the legitimacy of the result that is based on lies  by both campaigns to acquire support.

attributes.action: Replace BSL (breed specific law) with blanket legislation applying to all dogs.
attributes.background:
BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This should be replaced with a blanket legislation applying to all dogs regardless of breed.

The current legislation also falsely suggests that all dogs not of specific breeds must be friendly, which is not always the case.

attributes.action: Sell the Palace of Westminster. MPs to vote on where to relocate Parliament.
attributes.background: The iconic Houses of Parliament are in urgent need of repair. Moving parliament to a modern purpose built site would create much needed economic stimulus elsewhere in the UK. The existing Palace of Westminster would prove to be a popular tourist attraction.
attributes.additional_details: The Scottish Parliament and The Welsh Assembly have modern buildings, purpose built in the twenty first century. The Houses of Parliament which serve the whole of the UK were built in the nineteenth century. Repairing the structure while the day to day business of Parliament continues there, would be difficult and expensive. Our MPs deserve modern facilities. Once the new location has been selected and the new venue created, the Palace of Westminster could be sold off to be properly restored.

attributes.action: Bring Leasehold Housing into the Commonhold and Leasehold Reform Act 2002
attributes.background: There is a gap within the legislation to protect Leasehold Housing in the same way that leasehold flats are protected. Without that protection, management companies & maintenance companies can abuse the current system. House buyers need to be protected against escalating and unreasonable fees!
attributes.additional_details: If Leasehold Housing were brought into the current legislation leaseholders could gather together & form a committee and have the option to change the company or a Right to Manage. If Leasehold Housing stays outside the parameters of this legislation the only option leaseholders have is to go to a tribunal to challenge charges & if found guilty the company still cannot be replaced.Protection is required to regulate leasehold housing especially as many sites are now building on a leasehold basis.

attributes.action: Give more funding to brain tumour research.
attributes.background: Government spend on brain tumour research represented just 0.52% of its total spend on cancer research.  This cancer is the biggest killer of the under 40 age group. More funding is needed to help research this most aggressive form of cancer that is killing so many people.

attributes.action: Establish economic tests to assess readiness for Brexit.
attributes.background: The decision to leave the European Union will have huge consequences for the United Kingdom. The economic tests that were created to assess readiness for EMU provide a model for taking proper account of the economic consequences prior to notifying the EU of our intention to leave under Article 50.
attributes.additional_details: Various attempts have been made to estimate the cost to the UK of Brexit. Such an estimate has to take into account potential loss of trade, inward investment and joint R&D, as well as additional spending on the military, borders, redundancy and pensions, and bureaucracy. This is against the background of record debt (approx. 90% GDP). Parliament should establish metrics for the economic impact of each Brexit scenario (e.g. so-called hard or soft) so that an informed decision can be made.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket.
attributes.background: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket with reflective strips at all time when on the road and no headphones. To help them to be seen by motorists and they can hear what is happening on the road. This is after truck and car drivers are getting blamed for deaths of cyclists.

attributes.action: House of Commons should support the 'Taxes for Peace' Bill.
attributes.background:
The 'Taxes for Peace' bill will allow UK citizens the choice 'to divert the portion of their taxes that would ordinarily pay for military operations into a conflict prevention fund'. 
The bill was proposed by MP Ruth Cadbury on 19th July and could receive its second reading on 2nd December.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.conscienceonline.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/Taxes-for-Peace-Bill-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Stop street beggars from using live animals to support their begging.
attributes.background:
All over London's West End tourist spots there are gangs of Eastern Europeans using dogs to aid their begging.
The dogs are dressed up in clothes, hats and sunglasses, and are made to to sit out in all weathers for hours to attract the public and encourage them to give money.

attributes.action: Change the house buying process in England, Wales and NI
attributes.background: A petition to address the requirement of consumer protection when purchasing or selling a property. Minimising financial exposure and risk after price agreement and the subsequent common terms of sale changes; gazumping, gazundering and pulling out. MPs to create safeguards in earlier commitment.

attributes.action: NHS to change the term Mental Health to Personal Health to get rid of the stigma
attributes.background: Many people take their own lives through depression and various psychological health issues. The term "Mental" creates a huge stigma and fear for many people who feel if they see someone from a mental health service then it will affect them later for work etc.
attributes.additional_details:
People believe that if you see a mental health specialist then your classed as a mental health patient and fear of being sectioned sets in. By changing this term we can hopefully have more lives saved by letting people feel more relaxed about their personal health issues and maybe they will find the strength to speak out.
From personal experience i was worried about driving into a mental health unit after suffering depression. i then asked for an alternative venue to have my meetings.

attributes.action: Replace religious education in UK schools with a comparative history of religion
attributes.background: Religion can be the cause of social and educational schism.
attributes.additional_details: School is our first experience of institutional life and so, as a priority, it should be inclusive and harmonised from the outset. Religion is used in our schools as a context to teach ethics. A Comparative History of Religion will foster objectivity and tolerance, which are themselves virtuous. A Comparative History of Religion will produce an empirical lesson in social harmony that is psychologically wholesome, undeniable and therefore enduring.

attributes.action: Allow all people diagnosed with an ASC to access concessionary travel passes
attributes.background: The law as it stands regarding concessionary travel passes is discriminatory and outdated. For people with an Autistic Spectrum Condition there is a postcode lottery of access depending on their local council's definition of a "learning disability". This discrepancy must be resolved.
attributes.additional_details: The DSMv (diagnostic standards manual) effectively did away with the distinctions that had previously been drawn between autistic spectrum conditions. For several years now the standard diagnosis is for ASC and IQ is no longer routinely tested. This means that children are unable to meet the criteria for concessionary travel, despite their genuine social and sensory difficulties in accessing public transport. The guidelines must be updated.
